thread.title: Divya Pharmacy, the polluter

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Divya Pharmacy, the polluter
text:
Tribune News Service
Haridwar, October 25
Effluents from the factory at Divya Pharmacy, belonging to Yog Guru Ramdev, at the Indira industrial estate in Haridwar city, flow directly into the Ganga, near Rishikul. Residents of nearby Shiv Basti are quite annoyed at industrial effluents flowing out of Divya Pharmacy in a drain that passes through their area and finally falls into the Ganga. Perturbed at the indifferent attitude and inaction by Divya Pharmacy, Shiv Basti residents had also staged a protest outside the pharmacy gate. Raju, a resident, says the drain that passes through their houses is full of industrial effluents coming from Divya Pharmacy and finally flow into the Ganga. They face a constant threat of health hazards as Divya Pharmacy has neither fully covered the drain nor has it a sewage treatment plant. Meanwhile, despite repeated attempts the Divya Pharmacy manager was not available for comments. A security guard-cum-receptionist said they could not allow any outsider to enter the factory premises.
